Warm-Up: Before attempting Skandha Chakrasana, ensure you are properly warmed up. Perform shoulder, chest, and hip opening stretches to prepare your body for the pose.
Starting Position: Begin by standing tall with your feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed by your sides.
Interlace Fingers: Reach your arms behind your back and interlace your fingers. Press your palms together in a prayer position.

Inhale: As you inhale, lift your chest and gently arch your upper back. Keep your gaze forward and your chin parallel to the ground.
Exhale: On the exhale, begin to lift your clasped hands up and over your head, reaching towards your upper back.
Backbend: Continue to lift your arms and chest, allowing your head to drop back slightly if comfortable. Keep your core engaged to protect your lower back.

Open the Shoulders: Focus on opening your shoulders and chest as you deepen the backbend. Lift your heart towards the sky.
Hips and Legs: Keep your legs strong and engaged throughout the pose. Avoid locking your knees and maintain a slight bend in them.

Breathing: Maintain smooth and steady breathing as you hold the pose. Use each exhale to deepen the stretch and each inhale to expand your chest.
Hold and Release: Hold Skandha Chakrasana for 3-5 breaths or as long as comfortable. To release, slowly lower your arms back down to your sides on an exhale.\n\n
